conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state B to C, analyze the process on a P-V diagram.
The process from B to C involves a horizontal line, indicating constant pressure.
The pressure at state B and state C is 0.6p0.
The volume changes from V0 to 0.5V0.
The work done by the gas during a process at constant pressure is given by W = P ΔV.
Substitute into the work formula: W = 0.6p0 × (-0.5V0) = -0.3p0V0.
Interpret the negative sign: work is done on the gas (the gas is compressed).
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is -0.3p0V0.
